node.title: South Africa has secured $8.5 billion to transition away from coal. It’ll be a test case.
node.description: Developing nations have long said they need aid from wealthy countries to shift to renewable energy. South Africa may show how that would work in practice.

node.title: Eric Adams’s victory speech, in full.
node.description: By Walker Clermont

node.title: 'Everyone just had tears of joy': Joyful Carnarvon locals celebrate Cleo Smith's return
node.description: Celebrations are in full swing in Carnarvon as locals breathe a collective sigh of relief over the safe return of Cleo Smith, who was found alive this morning after vanishing from the Blowholes campgrounds more than two weeks ago.

node.title: 'Rare and unique' sights as photographers capture big weather events
node.description: Photographers brave all conditions to capture thunderstorms, dust devil and auroras for next year's Bureau of Meteorology calendar.

node.title: A Grand Slam Wasted, Atlanta Is Left Holding Its Breath
node.description: Adam Duvall’s blast felt like the where-were-you-when moment Atlanta has been seeking for decades. And then it wasn’t.

node.title: New Black N.B.A. Coaches Wonder Why It Took So Long to Get a Shot
node.description: The N.B.A.’s coaching ranks have long been dominated by white men, but a demand from Black players for more diversity may be changing things.

node.title: 'We're going to take you to see your mummy and daddy': Heartwarming video of moment Cleo is rescued released by police
node.description: Police release a heart-warming video of the moment officers rescued four-year-old Cleo Smith, who had been missing for 18 days.

node.title: Covid-19: Hamilton Mayor calls for separation from region once vaccination target reached
node.description: The mayor of Hamilton wants her city treated differently to the rest of the region once it reaches 90 percent fully vaccinated.

node.title: Videos of high school student brawl sparks investigation
node.description: Tasmania Police are investigating after footage emerged of a fight involving a large number of students at a Hobart high school, with a cyber-bullying expert warning the videos being circulated will only add to the harm.

node.title: The Best Decisions Happen When the Manager Should be Sleeping
node.description: A World Series manager’s life is full of distractions. For Dusty Baker, Brian Snitker and their predecessors, the middle of the night offers time to think about the game.

node.title: Jimmy Fallon: Biden Can Cut Emissions Just as He Did His Ratings
node.description: “I mean, he cut his approval rating in half in three months,” Fallon joked on Tuesday.

node.title: Scott Morrison may want to 'move on', but leaking Macron’s private texts only ensures French fury will linger
node.description: The Prime Minister may have felt justifiably injured after being branded a liar on the world stage, but this was the time for a cool head, not a hot one, writes Andrew Probyn.

node.title: U.S.-Russia Engagement Deepens as C.I.A. Head Travels to Moscow
node.description: It was at least the fourth trip to Moscow since July by a senior American official as the two sides seek to stabilize a volatile relationship.

node.title: Covid-19 : Aggressive demands for vaccine exemptions
node.description: The Covid-19 Response Minister says it is "unacceptable" to aggressively demand a vaccination exemption, as the government moves to create a central process for approving exemptions.

node.title: Who is Glenn Youngkin, the Republican who will be the next governor of Virginia?
node.description: Here's what to know about Glenn Youngkin, the Republican who will be Virginia's next governor.

node.title: Once a Climate Leader, Brazil Falls Short in Glasgow
node.description: The country’s proposals show a desire to burnish its image, but President Jair Bolsonaro’s record and his absence from the summit cast doubt on its commitment to reversing course.

node.title: A Chinese Tennis Star Accuses a Former Top Leader of Sexual Assault
node.description: Peng Shuai’s accusation against Zhang Gaoli takes the country’s budding #MeToo movement to the top echelons of the Communist Party for the first time.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 100 new community cases reported in New Zealand today
node.description: There have been 100 new Covid-19 cases in the community reported today - 97 in Auckland and three in Waikato.

node.title: Police seize 3kg of synthetic cannabis in Canterbury raids
node.description: As part of two-month long investigation, police have searched several Christchurch properties targeting a synthetic cannabis ring.

node.title: Glenn Youngkin’s Journey From the Heights of Finance to the Top Tier of G.O.P. Politics
node.description: Helped by his personal fortune, the victor in the Virginia governor’s race won over voters who were put off by Trumpism but were not, it turned out, entirely opposed to elevating another Republican.

node.title: Why Democrats Are in Trouble
node.description: The election in Virginia is more than just a reflection on Biden's failures.

node.title: Trump Celebrates Youngkin Win After Railing Against Fraud in Virginia's Election
node.description: Trump called for Republicans to "flood" the polls so Youngkin's victory was beyond the margin of "fraud" he believed would occur.

node.title: Police release photo after Cleo Smith found alive locked in Carnarvon house
node.description: Police have posted a photo of a smiling Cleo Smith, pictured in hospital, hours after she was rescued from a house in the coastal West Australian town of Carnarvon.

node.title: Darwin shooter apologises in court, explains why he pleaded guilty
node.description: Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann, who has pleaded guilty to murder and manslaughter, says there are two key reasons why he changed his plea from not guilty to guilty mid-trial.

node.title: Glenn Youngkin, a Republican financier, defeats Terry McAuliffe in the Virginia governor’s race.
node.description: Mr. Youngkin, a former private equity executive making his first run for office, focused on education and taxes while projecting a suburban-dad image to create distance from former President Trump.

node.title: GOP Representative Was Investigated in 2013 Child Abuse, But No Charges Were Filed
node.description: The Republican official said the Bible instructs parents to hit their kids as a form of love, adding that he would hug his child and give them a Rice Krispies treat afterward.

node.title: ‘My Name Is Cleo’: Girl Is Found 18 Days After Vanishing From Campsite
node.description: The 4-year-old had disappeared while camping with her family in a remote area of Australia. She was found “alive and well” in a locked house.

node.title: ABC, CNN Call Virginia Governor's Race for Glenn Youngkin
node.description: The Republican defeated former Virginia Governor Terry McAuliffe after surging forward in the polls in recent weeks.

node.title: Virginia Tested Kamala Harris' Campaign Skills Outside California. Her Party Lost
node.description: The vice president was one of several high-profile Democrats who campaigned alongside Democrat Terry McAuliffe in the days before Virginia's election.

node.title: Glenn Youngkin Wins Virginia, Blazing 2022 Trail for GOP Through American Schools
node.description: The Virginia race was widely viewed as a test of whether the Republican party's campaign against issues like critical race theory in schools would prove a sound strategy heading into the 2022 midterm elections.

node.title: Newsom Beats Trumpism in California, McAuliffe Didn't in Virginia
node.description: Both Gavin Newsom and Terry McAuliffe drew frequent comparisons between Donald Trump and their Republican competitors throughout their campaigns.

node.title: Changes to Queensland's border rules flagged as $1m stimulus comes into play
node.description: Motorists may be waved through Queensland's southern border when the state opens up next month. Meanwhile, struggling business owners are cheering a timely new round of discount vouchers.

node.title: House where Cleo Smith was found unremarkable, but today it's the nation's focus
node.description: The house where missing four-year-old Cleo Smith was found is unremarkable in every way, yet today it is the centre of one of the biggest police investigations in Western Australian history.

node.title: Police restrain assets of group illegally-housing migrant workers
node.description: A group of people accused of earned money from illegally-housed migrant workers in Auckland have been served restraining orders.

node.title: Braves win first World Series since 1995, beating Astros in Game 6
node.description: The Braves hammered the Houston Astros 7-0 Tuesday night.

node.title: Alec Baldwin shares posts disputing reports "Rust" set was unsafe
node.description: Baldwin has spoken publicly just a few times since the fatal shooting on the set of the film.

node.title: Republicans hold on to their last City Council seat in Queens.
node.description: Felicia Singh, a Democrat and teacher, was defeated by Joann Ariola, a longtime civic leader and chairwoman of the Queens Republican Party.

node.title: What We Learned From Week 8 in the N.F.L.
node.description: The Saints' defense stepped up when Jameis Winston went down, Josh Allen shook off an uncharacteristically sloppy start, and wide receivers around the league auditioned for Tuesday’s trade deadline.

node.title: College Football Playoff Rankings Bungle National Championship Betting Odds
node.description: There were a number of unexpected positionings given the outcomes of the weekend game.

node.title: Penrith Panthers terminate Tyrone May's NRL contract
node.description: The NRL premiers cut ties with Tyrone May, following his conduct on social media after the club's grand-final victory.

node.title: Man who used cattle prod to inflict 'sadistic' violence against partner jailed
node.description: A man who electrocuted his former partner with a cattle prod, threaten her with a gun and forced her to sleep outside has been found guilty of 12 counts of rape and three counts of aggravated assault.

node.title: 'Move on, frankly': PM says he has no intention of apologising to French President over sub decision
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says he will not apologise to France after President Emmanuel Macron accused the PM of lies and deceit over a cancelled submarine deal.

node.title: Govt funding to speed up medicinal cannabis industry
node.description: The government is putting $760,000 into a joint research programme to speed up the establishment of a medicinal cannabis industry here.

node.title: WA's COVID roadmap to be released on Friday, on the eve of NSW border rules easing
node.description: The WA government will release a roadmap on Friday for transitioning to living with COVID-19, a day before it downgrades New South Wales from an "extreme risk" state to "high risk".

node.title: Stage win for Invercargill rider on Tour of Southland debut
node.description: A spectacular climb up the Remarkables has given Invercagill rider Josh Burnett a stage win on his debut in the Tour of Southland.

node.title: Minneapolis voters reject ballot measure to dismantle police
node.description: The Associated Press projected the ballot measure to create a new Department of Public Safety had been rejected.

node.title: The Recipe for Coming Back From a 3-1 Deficit? It Varies.
node.description: The Houston Astros are trying to pull off a feat that has been done only six times in the World Series. Players from the teams that did it happily recalled their thrilling comebacks.

node.title: Buffalo mayor’s race hangs in the balance with write-in ballots.
node.description: The signs were promising for Byron Brown, the incumbent trying to defeat socialist India Walton, who won the Democratic primary in June.

node.title: Portland Man Who Fired Gun at Courthouse Wanted Trial for 'Political and Patriotic Reasons'
node.description: On Tuesday, a Portland judge handed down the ruling for 40-year-old Cody Melby, who fired a 9 mm handgun in the exterior of the Mark O. Hatfield federal courthouse in downtown Portland on January 8.

node.title: Former minister spent more than $18k in one year paying for Labor memberships, IBAC hears
node.description: An electorate officer of former Victorian Labor minister Marlene Kairouz tells a corruption hearing the member for Koroit would spend thousands of dollars a year on branch stacking by paying for other people's party memberships.

node.title: Michelle Wu is elected mayor of Boston.
node.description: Ms. Wu is the first woman and the first person of color to be elected mayor in Boston.

node.title: Resources Minister not required to consider climate change when awarding gas grant, lawyers argue
node.description: Lawyers for the federal government are arguing the Resources Minister was not required to consider the risks of climate change when determining whether to award $21 million in grants to a gas company.

node.title: Federal Court slams criminal case against ANZ as a 'complete shemozzle'
node.description: Prosecutors ditch a long-running criminal case against ANZ and one of its senior executives after the Federal Court describes the matter as a "complete shemozzle" and "fairly pointless".

node.title: Police restrain assests of group illegally-housing migrant workers
node.description: A group of people accused of earned money from illegally-housed migrant workers in Auckland have been served restraining orders.

node.title: Facebook to shut down facial recognition system
node.description: Facebook is shutting down its facial recognition system, which automatically identifies users in photos and videos, citing growing societal concerns about the use of such technology.

node.title: John Deere workers reject a revised contract proposal, extending their strike.
node.description: Workers upset over insufficient wage increases and pension benefits have been on strike since mid-October.

node.title: Eric Adams Defeats Curtis Sliwa in NYC Mayoral Race
node.description: "This is for all of you," the Democrat told New Yorkers as he wiped away tears after casting his ballot.

node.title: Minneapolis Rejects "Defund the Police" Plan as Crime Surges
node.description: The proposal had drawn significant attention around the country in the wake of calls for police reform.

node.title: Melbourne Cup favourite Incentivise injured
node.description: Beaten Melbourne Cup favourite Incentivise has emerged with a swollen leg after finishing second to Verry Elleegant at Flemington.

node.title: NSW Deputy Premier Paul Toole to call on colleagues to rule out new coal exploration zones
node.description: NSW Deputy Premier Paul Toole says he will be asking colleagues to oppose a proposal to open up new areas for coal exploration.

node.title: Former police officer who claimed vacant houses in property scam has jail term cut
node.description: A former Victoria Police sergeant who used obscure laws to steal houses from her unsuspecting victims has a year shaved off her jail term, but the judges brand her offending "breathtakingly dishonest".

node.title: Covid-19: Hamilton Mayor calls for seperation from region once vaccination target reached
node.description: The mayor of Hamilton wants her city treated differently to the rest of the region once it reaches 90 percent fully vaccinated.

node.title: More debt stress for Auckland and Northland businesses - data
node.description: Auckland and Northland have recorded more debt stress than the rest of Aotearoa, new data from Centrix shows.

node.title: Police Tactical Response Model to be trialled in four areas
node.description: Further details have been announced about the new Police Tactical Response Model set to begin later this month.

node.title: Rakiura Stewart Island bolstered by domestic tourism over pandemic
node.description: With New Zealanders unable to travel overseas, they've flocked to Aotearoa's third-largest island allowing it to buck the trend of most tourist markets.

node.title: Nelson fire destroys isolated bach
node.description: Firefighters have been transported to a fire at an isolated bach on Nelson's Boulder Bank by the Coastguard.

node.title: Minneapolis voters reject an amendment to replace the Police Department.
node.description: The amendment, which grew out of the anger over the murder of George Floyd, called for replacing the city’s police force with a new Department of Public Safety.

node.title: Mike Duggan wins a third term as Detroit’s mayor.
node.description: Mr. Duggan, a Democrat, has presided over a resurgence of Detroit’s downtown and a restoration of basic city services, even as many neighborhoods continue to struggle.

node.title: 'There were elections looming': Ambassador adds political motivation to why French sub deal was scrapped
node.description: The French ambassador suggests Australia's decision to scrap a $90 billion submarine deal could have been politically motivated, given the federal election is just around the corner.

node.title: NSW Premier orders review of how grants are handed out after new  pork barrelling claims
node.description: NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet says he is committed to making sure the grants process is fair after his predecessor Gladys Berejiklian's appearance before the corruption watchdog put government pork barrelling back in the headlines.

node.title: 'Hold that glimmer of hope': Suzie's sister disappeared in 1973, but says the Cleo Smith case shows families should never give up
node.description: Suzie Ratcliffe's sister, Joanne, disappeared from Adelaide Oval in 1973, in what remains one of the nation's most notorious cold cases. She says the "amazing" discovery of Cleo Smith is testament to the tenacity of investigators.

node.title: San Francisco Police Officer Charged With Shooting Man Who Died 3 Years Later
node.description: Officer Kenneth Cha, charged with voluntary manslaughter, “lacked a lawful basis to even arrest” the man and “elevated a nonviolent encounter,” the district attorney said.

node.title: The EU has cottoned on to imperfect carbon workarounds introduced by countries such as Australia and things are about to change
node.description: A carbon tariff is a carbon tax applied to exports from countries like Australia that don't have one. And Europe is planning to impose one, whether our politicians like it or not, writes Peter Martin.

node.title: 'The risk is too great': Health Minister defends Queensland's quarantine requirements for overseas arrivals
node.description: Queensland's Health Minister Yvette D'Ath stands firm on her decision to mandate hotel quarantine for returning overseas travellers after state borders open to interstate COVID hotspots next month.

node.title: Myanmar national in custody after jumping ship near Gisborne
node.description: A person from Myanmar is today in police custody in Gisborne after jumping off a ship at sea near Young Nicks Head last night.

node.title: Proposed UC Santa Barbara dorm faces criticism over lack of windows
node.description: An architect and member of the design review board quit over the project, calling it a "misguided experiment."

node.title: Eric Adams Is Elected Mayor of New York City
node.description: Mr. Adams, a Democrat and former police captain, will be the second Black mayor in the city’s history.

node.title: Voting is over and a winner is expected tonight in the New York City mayor’s race.
node.description: It is unclear when a winner will be declared, but in the 2013 election, the last open-seat mayoral race in the city, the contest was called less than an hour after polls closed.

node.title: How are DHBs across Aotearoa faring in vaccination rates?
node.description: Only five district health boards have hit the milestone for first jabs: Capital and Coast, Auckland, Waitematā, Canterbury, and Southern DHB.

node.title: Health and educational leaders urgently seek clarity over vaccine exemptions
node.description: Health and educational leaders are calling for urgent clarity over vaccine exemption certificates as the cut-off date looms for teachers to get vaccinated. Audio

node.title: Review: ‘Tammany Hall’ Votes the Party Line
node.description: An immersive show at the SoHo Playhouse takes theatergoers back to a speakeasy in 1929, when New York was also in a mayoral race.

node.title: De Blasio votes for his successor as he eyes a campaign for governor.
node.description: By Precious Fondren and Michael Gold

node.title: Michigan Latest State to Allow 'X' Gender Marker on Driver's Licenses
node.description: On Tuesday, head of the Michigan Secretary of State (SOS) Jocelyn Benson announced in a press release that on November 10, Michigan residents will be able to select a non-binary option, labeled as an "X" for both their driver's licenses and state identification cards.

node.title: Why would serial winner Antonio Conte join the Spurs?
node.description: A serial winner with Premier League success on his CV. It is easy to see why Tottenham Hotspur have appointed Antonio Conte as their new manager, but why would he take the position? BBC takes a look.

node.title: L.A. County approves $2.5 million settlement over Kobe Bryant crash photos
node.description: The settlement must now be approved by a court.

node.title: Clashing Portrayals of Kyle Rittenhouse in Testimony on Kenosha Shootings
node.description: Prosecutors described Mr. Rittenhouse as an out-of-town visitor who was armed illegally during tense protests over policing in Kenosha, Wis. His defense team said he was defending himself.

node.title: Democrats consider repeal of SALT deduction cap
node.description: Taxpayers can deduct up to $10,000 of their state and local taxes on their federal income tax.

node.title: Shontel Brown, a Democrat, wins an Ohio House seat in a special election.
node.description: The district, Ohio’s 11th Congressional District, encompasses most of Cleveland and much of Akron.

node.title: EPA Orders Michigan City to Repair Pipes, Better Inform Residents to Help End Water Crisis
node.description: "The people of Benton Harbor have suffered for too long," EPA Administrator Michael S. Regan said.

node.title: ACT records 15 new COVID-19 cases as cluster grows at Wanniassa School
node.description: The ACT has recorded 15 new locally acquired COVID-19 cases as the junior campus of Wanniassa School in Canberra's south closes due to a growing COVID-19 cluster.

node.title: 'It is a challenge, it's not popular' - Minister Mahuta on three waters criticisms
node.description: Local Government Minister Nanaia Mahuta continues to defend the proposed Three Waters reforms, saying people in rural areas should not be left behind the big cities. Audio

node.title: Pilot medical surveillance system 'belongs in dark ages' - expert
node.description: Pilots flying into medical trouble are protesting against a safety system they say is broken.

node.title: The virus is surging on the Navajo Nation, despite high vaccination rates.
node.description: Experts and tribal leaders aren’t sure why, but living near communities with low vaccination rates may be contributing.

node.title: Police say man in custody had 'no family connection' to Cleo Smith
node.description: WA police hail the successful search for Cleo Smith as "one of the most remarkable days in policing in Western Australia" and thank her parents and community for their resilience,

node.title: Fond memories, sad farewell as demolition begins on Gundagai's historic timber bridge
node.description: Gundagai's Prince Alfred Bridge has held a special place in the hearts of locals for generations, but after more than a century of service it is coming down.

node.title: Carole Baskin sues Netflix over "unauthorized footage" in "Tiger King 2"
node.description: The complaint claims "Tiger King 2" uses unauthorized footage of the plaintiffs and alleges they will suffer "irreparable harm" if the show is released.

node.title: For Holocaust Scholar, Another Confrontation with Neo-Nazi Hate
node.description: In a Charlottesville courtroom, Deborah E. Lipstadt will testify to the persistence of antisemitism, and its links to present-day politics.

node.title: Takeaways from the first day of the Kyle Rittenhouse trial.
node.description: Opening statements from the prosecution and defense were followed by testimony from a friend of Mr. Rittenhouse, an F.B.I. agent and a witness to the unrest in Kenosha, Wis.

node.title: A C.D.C. panel recommends Pfizer-BioNTech’s vaccine for children ages 5 to 11.
node.description: The Biden administration has enlisted 20,000 health workers and shipped 15 million doses ahead of the agency’s decision.

node.title: Initial Playoff Rankings Show Georgia at Top and Numerous Potential Contenders
node.description: The other would-be semifinalists in the first rankings of the College Football Playoff included Alabama, Michigan State and Oregon.
